excerpt: Tours are offered of this medieval castle rebuilt circa 1590 with prison cells used until 1950.
detail_description: Limassol Castle, located in the heart of Limassol's old town, is a medieval fortress with a rich history dating back to the crusades. The castle was rebuilt around 1590 and served as a prison until 1950. It stands as a dominant presence in the old town and offers tours for visitors interested in its historical significance. The castle also houses the Cyprus Medieval Museum, which boasts an impressive collection of antiquities spanning from 400 to 1870 A.D.
name: Lemesos Castle - Cyprus Medieval Museum

excerpt: Fully equipped marina with luxurious on-shore facilities & space for even large superyachts.
detail_description: Limassol Marina is a well-equipped marina with 650 berths, catering to large superyachts. It also features 236 luxurious residential units and a variety of restaurants and shops, creating a unique waterfront lifestyle. The marina offers fine dining options with international and local cuisine as well as cafes and lounge bars. Pier One Restaurant provides a modern dining experience in an industrial setting, while Dionysus Mansion offers vibrant culinary experiences.
name: Limassol Marina

excerpt: Limassol is a city on the southern coast of Cyprus. Itâ€™s known for the centuries-old Limassol Castle, home to the Cyprus Medieval Museum and its collection of pottery and tombstones. On the seafront is the Prokymea (Molos) Sculpture Park, with sculptures by Cypriot, Greek and international artists. To the northeast is the Limassol Archaeological Museum, exhibiting artifacts from the Neolithic to the Roman periods.
detail_description: Limassol, a city on the southern coast of Cyprus, boasts a rich historical heritage and diverse attractions. The centuries-old Limassol Castle houses the Cyprus Medieval Museum, showcasing pottery and tombstones. Along the seafront, Prokymea (Molos) Sculpture Park features works by local and international artists. The Limassol Archaeological Museum exhibits artifacts spanning from the Neolithic to Roman periods.
name: Limassol

excerpt: Modest, circa-1948 archaeological museum showcasing relics, statuary & art from old settlements.
detail_description: The Archaeological Museum of the Lemesos (Limassol) District, established around 1948, is a modest yet captivating attraction that offers a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage of Cyprus. Situated near the Limassol public Gardens, it houses an intriguing collection of relics, statuary, and art from ancient settlements in the region.
name: Archaeological Museum of the Lemesos (Limassol) District

detail_description: ESCAPE Limassol Old Town, also known as Lemesos, is a must-visit for those seeking an authentic Cypriot experience. The old heart of the city boasts narrow historical streets that lead out from the old harbor. It's a charming area filled with alfresco restaurants, trendy coffee shops, souvenir stores, and bars. At night, the twinkling lights and bustling atmosphere create a magical ambiance.
name: ESCAPE Limassol Old Town

excerpt: Modest zoo with mammals, birds & reptiles, plus a cafeteria, kids' playground & picnic facilities.
detail_description: Situated in the heart of the city, Limassol Zoo is a popular destination for families and animal enthusiasts. The zoo houses a diverse range of creatures, including mammals, birds, and reptiles, with a focus on education and conservation. Adjacent to the zoo are the tranquil Limassol Municipal Gardens, providing a serene escape from urban life. Following extensive renovations, the zoo now boasts an increased number of inhabitants and improved living conditions.
name: Limassol Zoo

excerpt: Vibrant waterfront promenade featuring parks, playgrounds, cafes, restaurants & local retail shops.
detail_description: Molos, located in Limassol, is a stunning waterfront promenade that offers a vibrant and multifunctional seaside park experience. Lined with delicate palm trees and small pools, the wide promenade features wooden piers and a park of sculptures. This picturesque area boasts numerous amenities such as cafes, restaurants, local retail shops, playgrounds, bike paths, fountains, and even a small skate park.
name: Molos

excerpt: Museum devoted to classic & collectible automobiles, including an early-20th-century Model T.
detail_description: The Cyprus Motor Museum is a private museum dedicated to showcasing classic and collectible automobiles, featuring a diverse collection of 70 historic vehicles. The exhibits include the iconic 1912 Ford T roadster, as well as notable cars such as the Cadillac used by the US President in 1977 and Margaret Thatcher's vehicle. Owned by a former rally champion, this museum offers an extensive display of vintage cars, from Mr. Bean's Mini Minor to various other means of transportation like bicycles and buses.
name: Cyprus Motor Museum

detail_description: Limassol Old Port is a captivating blend of modern and historical charm. Once a bustling fishing harbor, it has been revitalized into a stunning tourist center. The area boasts an excellent hotel in the heart of the historical district, offering beautiful rooms and top-notch staff. Visitors can also enjoy dining at good restaurants with picturesque views, making it a must-visit destination for those seeking to immerse themselves in the city's rich heritage while enjoying modern amenities.
name: Limassol Old Port

detail_description: Akti Olympion A beach is a 2-kilometer stretch of dark grey sand and calm waters in Limassol, Cyprus. It features cyclist lanes, widened footpaths, and convenient parking. The beach is family-friendly with various amenities and is an ideal spot for relaxation. Despite some pebbles and occasional litter, the clear waters make it safe for children. Additionally, the nearby restaurants and bars offer great dining options while enjoying the sea view.
name: Akti Olympion A beach

detail_description: Molos Promenade is a newly developed scenic coastal area in Limassol, Cyprus. It stretches from Limassol Marina to Olympia Beach, offering illuminated walkways, parks, cafes, restaurants, and playgrounds with stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea.
name: Molos

excerpt: Public park with shade trees, a playground & statues commemorating historical figures.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Limassol, the Limassol Municipal Garden is a serene oasis that offers a delightful escape from the bustling city life. This public park boasts an array of shade trees, making it an ideal spot for relaxation on warm days. Families will appreciate its well-maintained playground and charming statues that pay tribute to historical figures, adding a touch of culture to your visit.
name: Limassol Municipal Garden

detail_description: The Carob Museum is housed in a historic factory building that is over 100 years old and showcases the process of making chocolate from the sweet fruit of the local carob tree. Visitors can explore the museum's two floors, which feature authentic machinery used for processing carob fruits. The museum offers a fascinating insight into the history and significance of carob in Cyprus, making it a must-visit attraction for those interested in learning about traditional Cypriot industries.
name: Carob Museum

detail_description: The Municipal Museum of Folk Art in Cyprus offers a captivating journey through the island's rich folk history, art, culture, and traditions. Housed in a well-maintained old house, the museum showcases over 500 exhibits including national costumes, embroidery, jewelry, household tools, wooden chests, and tapestries.
name: Municipal Museum of Folk Art

detail_description: The Ayia Napa Cathedral is a stunning Greek Orthodox church located in Limassol, Cyprus. Situated along the seafront on Ayiou Andreou Street, visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll through the Molos area and take in the beautiful seaside park that stretches from the old port to Limassol Zoo. Built at the end of the 19th century on top of an older Byzantine church, this landmark offers breathtaking architecture and historical significance.
name: Ayia Napa Cathedral

excerpt: Spacious mall offering fashionable retail stores, a food court, ice-skating rink & bowling alley.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Limassol, My Mall Limassol is a spacious indoor shopping haven that promises an unforgettable experience for both locals and visitors. With its impressive array of fashionable retail stores spanning three floors, you can explore everything from renowned international brands like Tommy Hilfiger and Lacoste to charming local boutiques.
name: MY MALL Limassol

detail_description: The Limassol Wine Festival, held in the Municipal gardens since 1961, is a two-week event in September-October. It offers affordable tickets that include unlimited wine samples from vineyards across Cyprus. The festival features live music, dancing, theatrical performances, and local food. The vibrant atmosphere is complemented by well-organized stands and friendly staff. This annual celebration showcases the rich traditions of wine production on the island with cultural events creating a festive ambiance.
name: Wine Festival

detail_description: Anexartisias Street, located near the Old Port in Limassol, is a bustling shopping destination. The street is home to popular fashion brands like Zara, Mango, Bershka, and Guess, as well as numerous souvenir and jewelry stores. Visitors can explore a wide variety of shops offering trendy clothing and accessories, making it a must-visit for fashion enthusiasts and those looking for unique souvenirs.
name: Anexartisias

detail_description: KEO Winery & Brewery is one of the leading wineries on the island and a must-visit attraction in Cyprus. Their wide range of products includes liqueurs, cognacs, non-alcoholic beverages, as well as canned fruits and vegetables. Visitors have the opportunity to purchase these items directly from the factory without any additional markups during guided tours.
name: KEO Winery & Brewery

detail_description: Dasoudi Beach Maisonette and Pool is a perfect personal residence for families with children who love playing in the sand. The beach offers a playground and restaurants, providing endless entertainment for kids. Additionally, the maisonette features a pool, making it an ideal accommodation choice for families seeking both beach fun and relaxation.
name: Dasoudi beach Maisonette and Pool

detail_description: Saripolou Square is the vibrant heart of Limassol's center, offering a bustling array of cafes, bars, and restaurants. This area has undergone a remarkable transformation, becoming a hub of innovation and activity. It's a popular destination for both locals and visitors, especially attracting young crowds seeking great food and drinks in a lively atmosphere. With its diverse dining and entertainment options, Saripolou Square stands out as one of Limassol's most bustling locations.
name: Saripolou Square

detail_description: The Cyprus Theatre Museum, also known as the Municipal Cultural Centre Panos Solomonidis, is a fascinating attraction located near the center of Limassol. It showcases the history of theatrical activity from ancient Hellenistic and Roman times to 2010 through exhibits such as old posters, newspaper articles, and donated costumes and belongings of private actors. The museum is divided into three themes: history, contributors, and performance.
name: Cyprus Theatre Museum
address: M2JX+VXJ, Panos Solomonides 8 (ex, Androutsou 3032, Limassol 3032, Cyprus

detail_description: Karatello Tavern is a popular Cypriot restaurant in Limassol that offers a blend of traditional and modern cuisine. The rustic and welcoming ambiance, reminiscent of a wine cellar, provides the perfect setting to enjoy warm or cold coffee along with traditional meze dishes. This old warehouse turned rustic tavern features exposed brick walls and vintage decor, creating an authentic atmosphere for locals and travelers alike.
name: Karatello Tavern

detail_description: Dionysus Mansion is a popular spot located on 16th June Street in Limassol, Cyprus. The mansion offers a fabulous atmosphere and attentive service, making it an ideal destination for travelers seeking a unique dining experience. Visitors can indulge in flavorful and distinctive dishes while enjoying the charming ambiance of the mansion. With its prime location and excellent service, Dionysus Mansion stands out as a must-visit establishment in Limassol for those looking to savor delicious cuisine in an inviting setting.
name: Dionysus Mansion

detail_description: When in Limassol, a visit to the Old Town is a must. The narrow winding streets and charming, albeit crumbling, buildings make for a picturesque setting. Take your time wandering around, exploring the shops, and capturing the beautiful architecture with your camera. Don't forget to stop at the bars and restaurants that spill out onto the pavement for a delightful experience. This area is home to many hidden pubs and restaurants with pleasant music, making it perfect for leisurely strolls.
name: ÎŸÎ Î‘Î  - OPAP Old Town Limassol

detail_description: Paradox Museum Limassol offers an exciting and hands-on experience for visitors of all ages. The museum features interactive exhibits that are both fun and educational, making it a great place to spend time with kids. While some feel the museum could be larger, others appreciate the opportunity to explore and experience every exhibit at a leisurely pace. The friendly staff are commended for their assistance in navigating the paradoxical phenomena showcased throughout the museum.
name: Paradox Museum Limassol

detail_description: Saripolou Square is a vibrant neighborhood located in the heart of Limassol, known for its bustling atmosphere and wide array of options for coffee, drinks, cocktails, and delectable cuisine. The area has undergone significant revitalization, transforming the previously unremarkable city center into a hub of innovation and activity. This transformation has breathed new life into Limassol's urban core, making Saripolou Square a must-visit destination for locals and tourists alike.
name: Saripolou

detail_description: Limassol Sculpture Park is a must-visit destination along the 16-kilometer beach path, starting from the old port. The park hosts an array of beautiful sculptures created by renowned artists, offering something for every art enthusiast. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll while admiring the captivating artworks and taking in the scenic views. The well-maintained park provides ample opportunities to relax, enjoy a cup of coffee, or engage in sports activities.
name: Sculpture Park

detail_description: Amathus Capital is situated between Limassol and features the ancient cities of Amathus and Kourion, as well as the historically significant Kolossi Castle. These sites offer a glimpse into Cyprus's rich history and are must-visit destinations for travelers interested in exploring the island's past.
name: Amathus Capital
address: Agias Zonis 50 Arianthi Court, 1st Floor, Office 102, Limassol 3090, Cyprus

detail_description: Municipal Park is located near the Old Port area and offers a serene escape from the bustling city center. While it's a popular tourist spot, the park provides a peaceful retreat despite the surrounding noise.
name: Municipal Park

detail_description: Gin Fish - Seafood Bar offers a stunning view of the sea and coastal promenade, making it a perfect spot for seafood and gin cocktail enthusiasts. The extensive menu of gin cocktails can be overwhelming, but the creative seafood dishes like Way salmon with champagne sauce and caviar are highly recommended. Guests rave about the octopus in red wine and whipped feta Greek salad.
name: Gin Fish - Seafood Bar

excerpt: Former pumping-station-turned-museum, with exhibits on how water is pumped, measured & consumed.
detail_description: The Water Museum, located near the old Water Pumping Station in Limassol, offers an educational experience for families. The museum showcases the history of water pumping and consumption through exhibits featuring tools and machines used in the past. Visitors can also watch a short film highlighting the importance of water, particularly designed to engage children. Additionally, there are displays of old water meters that offer a unique perspective on water management.
name: The Water Museum

detail_description: St. Catherine Catholic Church located in the MOLOS area of Limassol offers Sunday mass services in both English and Greek, providing a convenient location for those staying at Crown Plaza hotel. The church is beautifully decorated for Christmas and is well-kept, making it a favorite among visitors to the area. It serves as an important religious center for the community with dedicated priests who offer warm welcomes to all who attend. Additionally, taking a peaceful walk along the seaside to reach St.
name: St. Catherine Catholic Church

detail_description: Miami Beach - Blue Flag is a popular spot for both tourists and locals, offering clean sandy shores and a friendly atmosphere. It's not very large, but it's well-kept and provides amenities like shade, snacks, and nearby restaurants. While the sea may not be the cleanest, it's still an excellent place to soak up some sunshine and catch a beautiful sunrise. Additionally, fitness enthusiasts can head to Power Beach just a short walk away.
name: Miami Beach - Blue Flag

detail_description: Columbia Beach Resort in Pissouri Bay, Cyprus has become a beloved destination for beach enthusiasts, partygoers, and food lovers. This multifaceted venue offers an international restaurant, a lively day and night bar, an exclusive adults-only pool area, and luxurious grassy spaces with private sandpits.
name: Columbia Beach
address: Î ÏÎ¿Î¼Î±Ï‡ÏŽÎ½ Î•Î»ÎµÏ…Î¸ÎµÏÎ¯Î±Ï‚ 6, Agios Athanasios 4103, Cyprus

detail_description: Bar Du Soleil is an all-day bar located at the Old Port, offering a variety of brunch dishes such as different styles of eggs and delicious cocktails. The ambiance features low lights and a DJ, creating a nice environment for visitors to enjoy their drinks and sharing bites. While reservations are highly recommended, especially in the evening, the staff is described as super friendly and helpful.
name: Bar Du Soleil

detail_description: Epsilon Resto Bar is a modern and cozy restaurant located at Limassol Marina, offering stunning views from its verandas. The menu features a selection of authentic Mediterranean dishes with international fusion touches. Guests can enjoy the chill-out vibe created by the open-air setting, decor, and music while unwinding to tunes by the full-service bar. Epsilon Resto Bar is known for its delicious food and beautiful terrace overlooking the yachts at Limassol Marina.
name: Epsilon Resto Bar
address: M29Q+RHV, Limassol Marina St, Limassol 3014, Cyprus

detail_description: MEZE Taverna Restaurant, situated in the historic old town of Limassol, is a cherished dining spot offering an authentic taste of traditional Cypriot cuisine. Established over two decades ago by the Stavrou family, this family-run eatery has upheld the rich flavors and culinary techniques of Cypriot cooking through generations. The cozy and rustic ambiance, adorned with wooden decor, exudes the island's warm hospitality. Guests are welcomed by friendly staff who ensure a homely atmosphere.
name: MEZE Taverna Restaurant

detail_description: The Cookhouse, located on Limassol's Gladstonos street, is a charming and trendy brunch spot that offers a wide variety of traditional and healthy food options. The all-day menu features delicious breakfast, lunch, and dinner choices with the pancakes being a standout favorite. While reservations are not accepted, the wait time is usually around 10 to 15 minutes due to its popularity.
name: The Cookhouse

detail_description: Marina Breeze Resto Bar, situated in the prime area of Limassol Marina, offers a diverse experience throughout the day and night. The venue boasts an international menu with options ranging from classic English breakfast to healthier choices like quinoa porridge. In addition to a wide array of hot and cold beverages, including cocktails, Marina Breeze also hosts thematic nights and after-parties with DJ sets.
name: Marina Breeze

detail_description: Nestled in the renovated area of Limassol's Old Port, this charming market offers a delightful mix of artisanal products, local crafts, and delectable street food. The picturesque setting by the sea provides a relaxed shopping experience with a view. The cobbled paths and historic architecture of the port create a captivating journey into Cyprus's past within modern-day surroundings. With its balance between history and modern comfort, including waterfront eateries and shops, it offers a nostalgic yet vibrant ambiance.
name: Old Port

detail_description: The Pattichion Municipal Museum â€“ Historical Archive â€“ Limassol Studies Centre is a museum in Limassol, Cyprus. It houses artifacts from the region's history, as well as exhibits on local culture and history. The centre also operates a library and research centre.
name: Pattichion Municipal Museum â€“ Historical Archive â€“ Limassol Studies Centre
address: Limassol State Officer residense, Limassol 3035, Cyprus

detail_description: Cleopatra is a Cypriot and Lebanese cuisine restaurant located in Limassol.
name: Cleopatra
address: Christiana Court, Shop 2&3, John F. Kennedy, Limassol 3106, Cyprus

detail_description: Limassol AGORA is a charming spot located in the building of an old traditional grocery store. The upper floor offers benches with access to sockets, making it a great place to work or study while enjoying light meals from local restaurants. The atmosphere is clean and inviting, with polite staff and a rooftop bar as an extra highlight. Visitors can also find boutiques and various fast food options representing different cuisines.
name: Limassol AGORA

detail_description: Sousami is a distinctive bar in Limassol that offers a unique experience. It showcases talented DJs who play house, techno, and new disco music. The establishment's standout feature is its enchanting back courtyard, which can be enjoyed regardless of the season. The venue has a relaxed and tranquil atmosphere that appeals to those who prefer smaller spaces rather than large, bustling clubs. Inside, guests can dance and revel in the DJ's impressive selections.
name: Sousami

detail_description: Mason Bar is a trendy spot in Limassol, known for its industrial-inspired decor and an extensive selection of spirits and creative cocktails. The bar offers a relaxed atmosphere with an eclectic music playlist, making it the perfect place to unwind and experience the vibrant nightlife of the city. With a funky electronic music scene and a lively backyard where guests can dance or enjoy drinks while listening to various DJs, Mason Bar attracts a cool crowd.
name: Mason Bar

detail_description: Neon Phaliron is a Mediterranean restaurant situated in Limassol, Cyprus. It offers traditional salads and appetizers made from local produce, as well as seafood dishes and special chef's creations like marinated pork and Caribbean turkey. Visitors have praised the quality of the food and service, with particular mention of the Cypriot dessert Anarokrema. The restaurant's ambiance is likened to a charming French bistro with pleasant music and attentive waitstaff.
name: Neon Phaliron
